item.title: Bootstrapping my macOS workspace - Part 2
item.description: Following part 1 on tweaking macOS, this part will focus more on some handy tools and configuration for software development.

item.title: Bootstrapping my macOS workspace - Part 1
item.description: I have experienced a number of different Mac systems, ranging from the old white MacBook 2006 to the MacMini 2010 and MacBook Pro 13” and 15” lately. Time Machine has helped me a lot to transfer data from the old to the new machine. Nevertheless, a lot of changes, mostly for software development, have often been ignored or reset to the defaults due to many reasons (e.g. against security advice, etc.). And I often find myself searching around everytime for some desirable settings. Thus, this post is kind of a note to self on few useful tweaks for my development box so that I can easily reach out later.
